sentence.text: Indeed , for both it is ridiculous that a man who has no claim on the world 's attention , should nonetheless be able to exact full obedience from his wife .
After the hearing the woman said : ` It 's ridiculous that I have been brought to court .
The Department of Transport says it 's ridiculous that after seven years Hereford is still no nearer getting its bypass .
I know some people accused us of whingeing , but it was ridiculous that they were able to benefit from something that was entirely their fault .
It is ridiculous that two-thirds of the cost of a bottle of whisky goes to the Treasury and the taxation rate is double that of imported wines . " -- PA
It was ridiculous how she felt about Alain .
It would be ridiculous to claim that the resistance of the last two decades has achieved nothing , for on the contrary it has brought about significant , noticeable change .
It is clearly ridiculous to suggest that effective research can be carried out only in the absence of an adult experimenter .
In any case , she told herself , it would be ridiculous to antagonise him , especially as , like it or not , they still had to work together .
He had a way of dealing with objections which , even if he did n't face them , made it appear absolutely ridiculous to maintain the opposite position .
The truth is that Mark had always known him as Steven and naturally found it ridiculous to change to Morrissey .
Nevertheless , it does not seem ridiculous to consider parallels between the developing embryo/foetus and the evolution of our species .
It would have been ridiculous to write about Marilyn Monroe [ he is the author of Goddess ] without covering her sex life , or indeed to write a biography of anyone without discussing sexuality .
It is potty and ridiculous to suggest that stopping people spraying their armpits with deodorants will have an effect on issues of that scale .
It seemed to her ridiculous at such a time ` to ask this man to make a defence .
That would be ridiculous at my age anyway .
Many now believe that it is ridiculous for the final games to be played out after one player has already established himself as the champion .
He told himself that it was ridiculous for him to be nearly trembling with fear , wondering what form her explosion would take .
It seems ridiculous for me to try and offer excuses why we were so comprehensively beaten , but the fact that we were well below full strength certainly gave Alborne a ten-goal advantage .
He liked the offworlder well enough , but it was ridiculous for Zurachina even to consider the suggestion .
They say : It 's ridiculous for the council to want the flag down .
The hon. Gentleman 's remarks about the privatisation of PSA are fanciful and ridiculous in the extreme .
HOW ridiculous of Prime Minister Major 's son James to flare up and get sent off in a public school friendly football match .
But such an explanation is surely ridiculous to the modern reader forced to realize how far he stands from an age when mythological explanations were permissible .
Mallachy could tell he 'd been ridiculous from his face , and Rory had confessed immediately .
Most censorship decisions appear faintly ridiculous in the light of day .
Leonora kept her temper with difficulty , feeling ridiculous with her legs dangling from the high stool .
When I left the airport it was beautiful hot sunshine at 8.30 in the morning , and I felt rather ridiculous with my heavy overcoat and scarf tucked under my arm .
It 's ridiculous one should be so shocked by falling down . "
That 's a ridiculous statement !
His methods of computation may be ridiculous , but he is right to think that they do not love him , and his sense of bitter ingratitude causes his madness .
I have to say , however that , in the end -- and this applies particularly to the right hon. Gentleman 's peroration -- I thought that he was rather ridiculous .
The very idea of this lot going back whence it came was ridiculous and the impression was reinforced as I began to push .
It was n't until her mother had issued those ridiculous and unnecessary warnings over driving alone at night that the idiocy of her own attitude had dawned on her .
The very idea of Kenneth Williams protecting anyone is so ridiculous that it is laughable , but Halliwell did n't see things that way .
